post.body: Hello ZeroMe!

I have made an 0gallery-hub, that contains everything tagged with lolicon from pomfpomf.moe before 08.11.16.
[Here](../1PomfMoeTPxQ5gLJBeD1sBvaizxbHxf8Zv/) is the link to the hub. It contains 475 doujins(all in english), that all feature lolicon content, in some way shape or form.
Pressing the `Download and help distribute all files`-button in the 0-menu will help a great deal and would be highly appreciated as is sharing the hub with others.
@Nekololi: Can you add the [pomfpomf.moe 0gallery-hub](../1PomfMoeTPxQ5gLJBeD1sBvaizxbHxf8Zv/) to the [LoliGuide](../1LoLis8K1kohYduZuwsFc1wt3PFsbZMMUn/)?

So I just had a power outage and of course it's the day I release the pomfmoe 0gallery-hub...
But I'm(my node is) back online now, so the [pomfpomf.moe 0gallery-hub](../1PomfMoeTPxQ5gLJBeD1sBvaizxbHxf8Zv/) is now seeded again. Sorry for the downtime.

I feel like more people need to be aware of [briar](https://briarproject.org/), an instant messaging app similar to whatsapp(=facebook), telegram, and signal. It is free, open-scource, has  true end-to-end encryption(looking at you whatsapp), also has no and don't relies on any central servers and can run even in the case of crisis, for example if the internet infrastructure is somehow destroyed.

I don't know why, but seeing this made me smile.
(Screenshot taken from nofishs talk at the decentralized web summit this year)

I made a tutorial on how to install Zeronet on QubesOS. [Here](../1PexoLogqCsGAwYEUNqKnmzccg1r5tzCZ3/?Post:5:How+to+install+Zeronet+on+QubesOS) is an link to it if someone is interested.

In other news, I have a blog now, feel free to take a look at it: 
[1PexoLogqCsGAwYEUNqKnmzccg1r5tzCZ3](../1PexoLogqCsGAwYEUNqKnmzccg1r5tzCZ3/?Home)

So, [PomfPomfMoeGallery](../1PomfMoeTPxQ5gLJBeD1sBvaizxbHxf8Zv/) just jumped from ~50 peers to ~210 peers. Not that I'm complaining, but: Why? And even more interestingly the peers on ZeroHello didn't shoot up, that means that ~30% of anybody on onionland-zeronet just decided to go for some loli fun.

ZeroHello jumped from ~500 to ~2700 peers and all other zites I have, have at least doubled their peer count. In addition to that, this is now far too long the case, to be some kind of weird tracker/peer miscalculation thingy and I have not seen anyone else mentioning or talking about anything in that regard. So: Have I missed something, like a newspaper publishing a story about zeronet or something, or is this peer increase only on my client?

I have just adjusted the [How to install Zeronet on QubesOS](../1PexoLogqCsGAwYEUNqKnmzccg1r5tzCZ3/?Post:5:How+to+install+Zeronet+on+QubesOS) guide on my blog, to now work for the Tor Browser Bundle version 8.
If there are any questions about the adjustments, feel free to ask!

I now have Tox. Here is my ID:
```
38B45630BEF5B3F1148AF7FBA19ED4CC29ECBB50756DF6CBC0B0B302D0DB19471A6F08E04C18
```
Shoot me a friend request if you want.

I think I'm gonna make a ZeroMe-hub dedicated for pedos and pedo content, this may also include CP. This will give new pedos a new safe place to post(without fear of being censored/deleted by the hub owner), gives regular users a pretty clear idea what to expect and where to expect it, so that they can either purposely go there and join/listen in on the discussion or avoid/blacklist it entirely because the dont like it. That will also (in the case of CP) take some weight off the current hub maintainers, since PedoHub is a place that can be pointed/referred to if one wants that.
Should I submit it to ZeroSites or any of the other search engines?
@nekololi: Meet sweet and adorable.

I have made a ZeroMe hub, intended to be used by pedophiles.
It's name is PedoHub.
On there pedos can post and socialize freely without fear of being removed/banned by the owner of the hub they are posting on. This is also intended to take some weight of the shoulders of the current hub runners, by being a place where posting (for example) childporn will be allowed.

The index.html of the PedoHub zite does not contain any illegal material and does not need to run JS, so you can give it a visit if you're interested in it.
The hub itself works like any other hub on ZeroMe, images are downloaded, only if you click on 'SHOW IMAGE'. This means that merely downloading the hub, to see the posts on there will not automatically download childporn onto your computer(i.e. get you in trouble).

While PedoHub is targeted at pedos, it is not restricted to only them. If you aren't a pedo, but still want to be on this hub, then you are welcome to make your account there.
Any accounts on PedoHub can post up to 100MB worth of text and 1GB worth on images and media. Accepted certificate providers are:

- peak.id
- polar.id
- nobody
- kxoid.bit
- kaffie.bit
- zeroid.bit
- zeroverse.bit
- zeropolska.bit

You can also register with these ones:

- millchan
- ifs.anonymous
- 0ch.anonymous

I (for obvious reasons) will not post it's address here for the general public to see. If you want to use the hub, please tell me you want the address(by sending me an [ZeroMail](../1MaiL5gfBM1cyb4a8e3iiL8L5gXmoAJu27/?to=pexo), ask me in the comments, tox or some other way to contact me) or visit one of the major pedo zites, as I will post it's address publicly on those, since they are not in the eyes of the general public.

The major blocklists have been notified about PedoHub and were given it's address.

If there are any questions, complains, suggestions, improvements or concerns you can always ask me and I'll try to address them as good as possible.
~
This post was edited on the 28th of December 2018 to update, the supported ID providers.

~~There are probably not many people, that know this:
If you're writing a comment under a post on ZeroMe and press `[SHIFT]+[ENTER]` instead of just `[ENTER]`, you'll make a new line, instead of sending the comment.~~

This got fixed, thanks to @Nofish: 
Everything behaves as normal, now. You can press `[CTRL]+[ENTER]` to send the comment.
@Kannalo: But how can she even compare?

I feel like sharing, what I think is probably the best video on youtube. It explains basically everything about modern politics and the complicated, devilish nature of power.
It's made by CGP Grey. Here is the link(Clearnet):
> [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rStL7niR7gs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rStL7niR7gs)

I've been thinking for some time now about building a zite for stories/fan-fiction/erotica, that:
- has a tagging system similar to what I described in [this](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1542671496_1GDcCK6cWoj98mg541Yj9rW1nwXcBz87eE/Announcing+1+Gallery+an+updated+ZeroGallery+Merger#comment_29_1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC) ZeroTalk thread, with the ability to import to common usenet story tag format and similar ones.
- has a collaborative writing feature
- has the ability to author 'choose your own adventure' stories (think visual novels, but without the visual)
- has a place where users can post story ideas/requests, that authors can pick up and fulfill and other users can point to stories, that closely match that idea/request.
- has a branching feature were anyone can make an alternative from an chapter of an story, they like and continue their story in the at that chapter.
- supports markdown, plain text and rich text formatted stories and can export and import those into each other
- has a feature, that remembers where you left on which story and what stories you have already red.
- gives the ability to have a watchlist for ongoing series
- gives the ability to subscribe to different authors
- comment on stories privately, publicly or anonymously.
- uses merger hubs, so mods=gods will be no issue
- also uses the vote system for the tags for the visibility of user content, that can promote stories(all thresholds will be adjustable for each user, so he can choose how much trust to put in to that) to deal with spam/ill willed people.
- is open source

Would anyone here be willing to help me make that into an reality?

I'm back! Got to spend a couple of days with my family again, which was actually more fun than I thought.
How was everyones Christmas this year?

So, this is unlikely, to have been of malicious intent, but this should be taken as somewhat of a warning to people:
[ZeroBoard](/1Gfey7wVXXg1rxk751TBTxLJwhddDNfcdp) is **not** anonymous. If you try to make post there the zite makes a clearnet connection to: `https://zeroid.qc.to/ZeroBoard/add.php`, sends the message and your auth key there and does something with it (by the looks of it, verifying and posting it) on that server. This exposes(leaks) your ip-address and auth key, as well as your message to that server.

So, I just got out of the most frustrating few days I had in at least a decade.

Anyway, Happy New Year!
I hope you all had a better start of 2019 than I had.

I made a ZeroTalk post about an universal tagging system, I'm currently working on.
[Here](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1547322502_1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC/UFTS+A+hopefully+global+tagging+system+for+ZeroNet) is the link if someone is interested in that.

In case anyone is wondering:
Due to the canvas fingerprint protection in the tor browser versions 8 and above, every image you upload will be white.
This applies to profile images and images in posts.

If you want to post images or upload a profile image, you'll have to temporarily disable the canvas fingerprint protection or temporarily use firefox(or any another browser) while you're uploading the image.

Would you consider AI generated child porn to be ethical (acceptable)? 
Assuming the AI would have been trained without ever seeing/requiring a single frame of actual child porn.

Apparently Mozilla is planning(or rather looking) to integrate TOR into the mainstream release of Firefox.

>“Mozilla has an interest in potentially integrating more of Tor into Firefox, for the purposes of providing a Super Private Browsing (SPB) mode for our users. Tor offers privacy and anonymity on the Web, features which are sorely needed in the modern era of mass surveillance, tracking and fingerprinting."

[Here](https://blog.torproject.org/mozilla-research-call-tune-tor-integration-and-scale)(Clearnet) is the blog post about it on torproject.org.

So, I started watching Kodomo No Jikan over on loligods [LoliUp](/1Yc1VyAhxsh1LEw7xes9hFQMdfWLKuE6S) recently and despite having only watched the first two episodes, I already *really* like the show. I have heard people speak very highly of it in the past and so far, I would agree with that.

Definitely something I can recommend, to at least give a try.

*Praise be LoliGod, for blessing us(me) with these gifts!*

For your interest: Out of all ZeroMe hubs, PedoHub comes in at third in terms of registered accounts and is the second fastest growing hub, only beaten by MoonHub (the current default hub on ZeroMe).

(However activity on PedoHub is really low, so most of them are either lurking or saw emptiness, lost interest and left)

After a week of isolation from everything (reasons are personal) I am happy to say that I'm back now!

I'm still busy catching up and reading about what happened while I was gone and wow, there's a lot that happened last week.

A little bit late, I guess, but congratulations to sadpanda and for rising from the dead and apparently rip 8chan.

@Nofish: Please check your ZeroMail!

A memory bug (very likely) effecting all currently existing ZeroNet zites has been found.

**It is neither security critical nor exploitable, but will heavily impact performance on api heavy zites.**

---

The bug has been fixed. See Nofishs [blog post](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:149:Version+0.7.1) for more info.

The bug I mentioned [here](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC/1566238186) has been fixed.
It was a memory leak in the default `ZeroFrame.js`, which was accumulating response entries indefinitely, causing all zites to eventually slow down due to high memory usage. How quickly they slow down depends on how often api calls are made. 

Since the `ZeroFrame.js` script is cloned when a new zite is created  this issue will be present on all zites that have been created before the second of September 2019.
## If you are a zite owner or developer please update your zites ZeroFrame.js!

---

Date of the bugfix: 2019-09-02
Date of the disclosure: 2019-08-19 via ZeroMail.

More information can be found on Nofishs [blog post](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:149:Version+0.7.1).

I made a single HTML page tool, that will display all contents of the sqlite database of the zite.  
  
The source is available on [GitCenter](../1us6a7ZNRRwJsq3Dwaho1TijtjSAVbNYg) and consists of only a single html file, that can be copy/pasted anywhere within your zite. To see the database simply navigate to where you pasted the file in your zite with your browser.  
  
This is meant as a debug tool for zite developers and not for the average user.

---

Improvements/bug reports/contributions and so on are welcomed and greatly appreciated.
If you have any questions feel free to ask me.

@Ansho Rei: The download of the GitCenter hub fails for me . Neither 1+Gallery nor 1+GalleryHub.
Maybe resigning them manually (though the 0menu) works?

@Nofish: Please check your ZeroMail!

(I'm convinced I already posted about this some time ago, but cannot find it anymore, so I figured I should go for the safe option here and send it again.)

A security bug impacting ZeroMe has been found.

It does **not** impact the security in a way that would allow for remote code execution, compromising cryptography or private keys. However it will allow an attacker to force all other seeders of a ZeroMe hub to seed one image of his choosing.

@Nofish: Could you take a look at this GitCenter issue?
[Consider nested includes when checking for valid signers of a file](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?1P4w4Rvh4vS9r6G5xTiSh8qEW87EKZtnJB/12@1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC)

The github account I made yesterday, was flagged and not visible to anyone, when I logged back on today...
Neat!
Granted my choice of name `pexophile` was not ideal (amazingly enough `pexo` was already taken), but didn't expect to be globally muted after just one day without any malicious behavior (not that I wanted to be malicious, but it's the thing that's usually immediately assumed when I face people).
  
I just sent an appeal to the GitHub support team, I'm curious to see how this goes.

---

EDIT: It looks like the license spammer on the ZeroNet GitHub repo thought I was an alt account @Git Center: made and reported me for having a 'sexually obscene' username. I then got globally muted by the GitHub moderation team.  
I got in touch with the GitHub staff and have my account back and renamed now. The new name is `pexo-zn`.

I have my GitHub account back!
To be better in line with the GitHub guidelines I renamed it to `pexo-zn`, which to be honest is much better than the name I had at first.

I'm back to ZeroNet again.
I hope I didn't miss anything important while being away.  
  
Also, even though it's a bit late by now: Merry Christmas and happy new years everybody!

@Damian8: Could you please consider moving to PedoHub? 
Posting child porn on the public hubs really hurts the public perception of ZeroNet, which is bad for the entire network. On top of that, please realize that a fair number of people are not protected when they browse ZeroNet and could get into very serious legal issues for seeing child porn. 
Feel free to ask me, if you have any questions regarding what you need to do in order to do that(or if you have any question at all).

That you tag what images are child porn is highly appreciated, by the way.
I wonder, is anyone here aware of a post-quantum messenger?

I just rediscovered what [DC-nets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dining_cryptographers_protocol)(clearnet) are and after a bit of searching was made aware of [PriFi](https://prifi.net/)(clearnet). It builds on DC-nets to provide traffic analysis resistant(!) anonymous small local network(WLAN and LAN) access.
Their marketing is a bit confusing, though. Since they make it out as kind of a competitor to TOR, but only talk about application in small local networks.  
  
Nevertheless this looks **really** interesting.

Looks like PornHub now has a official Tor hidden service:
pornhubthbh7ap3u.onion  
[Press release](https://www.pornhub.com/press/show?id=1911)(clearnet)
  
Although it's a bit disappointing that they chose a v2 hidden service and not a v3 one, as they are faster and more secure in about every aspect. Also of note is that the site still makes several connections to regular clearnet sites(such as phncdn, which actually hosts the content on PornHub).  
Nevertheless, at least in my opinion, this is a huge step in the right direction!

comment.body:
@Vanadium: Someone also posted cp on /l/ about a month ago, but the BO quickly reacted and banned him.
That one time on /l/ and /CP/ aside, I know of no other cases of cp. And I don't think I would've missed something. Maybe nekololi just forgot to blacklist /CP/?
@Musickiller: millchan is currently the biggest imageboard on zeronet. [Here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/) is the link if you want to have a look.
May I ask where you found it?

@Nekololi: And thus my envy for people like you, that can actually read moonspeak, grows furthermore...
Anyway: Do you have more 0gallery hubs? Asking for a friend, of course.
@Nekololi: Well than I know as much as you do now, I guess.

@Styromaniac: 
Ok, just wanted to let you two know, that this exists now.
>I don't block legal porn
I guess it depends on where you live. Where I am you will get shot by your neighbor on the streets if they know that. That aside I think Canada for example banned lolicon by law.
@Nekololi: Thanks

@Nekololi: With all the doujins it is around 6.3 GB in size. It took around 2 hours to parse the zip archive to an usable format. I did some optimizations to the thumbnails, so that they would be faster.

@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: I just did that, just to be sure.
Is anyone else experiencing problems?
Maybe try to activate tor-only mode, see if that solves anything.

@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: Nice and yes the archive is around 6.3 GB in total, but required files are much less than that. It took solid 5 minutes to just sign the hub and my computer is really not on the low end of things :3
@Nekololi: Thanks for the tip, just added it there. Are there more link lists?
@Nekololi: Thanks, I'll look into it.

That makes me sad :(
All the more reason for people to move here.

You've just had me really excited and now I'm sad...
*anxiously awaiting multi-threading*
@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: Didn't mean to sound ungrateful, I'm so excited I just really can't wait for it to finally happen. Multi-threading will be an immense usability improvement.
@Pexo: I'm also really excited for i2p support, since that will make the last central thing(the trackers) left also decentralized(in addition to solving a lot of the GFW issues).

@Styromaniac: He did say he'd get to it eventually and then i2p support was developed by str4d. Then some time later development on it stopped and since ~~around 2015(-ish)~~ October 2016 there hasn't been any new progress. From what I gathered Nofish didn't have the time to fully understand DHTs and the inner workings of i2p, which is why it is on halt right now.The [PR](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/pull/602) from str4d is still on github, if you want to have a look.

I don't know if you know this already, but the release of the TorBrowser 8 has completely broken canvas image generation and the upload of files using BigFilesPlugin(if you done them as the reference implementation in the docs). Peeper is also affected by this, as an mitigation I would suggest you use an library to generate the thumbnails and fix the upload via the BigFilePlugin, you can look at the source of [millchan](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/12NPW6WLFBLVivNGqijcfktARobftfLFAN:dev:b79fce8b-df0d-4ab4-a89e-4c37585aa6d1) as a reference, since mcdev has already fixed these issues.
@Nofish: These issues also apply for ZeroMe.
@Realjohndoe: 'Sub.
@Thornranger: You must have one sweet audience for ~2500(it's risen again) people to not only read your posts, but also being inspired enough to download zeronet and run it.

@Styromaniac: 
I agree with anything @nekololi: said
>I don't see a reason to even bring up the idea that there may be a point attempted.
Any action taken by someone is never without reason. Not wanting to search for and understand that reason invites needless conflict. You should judge by someones intention, not what you want their intention to be nor what they appear to be.
At least that's my philosophy on that. 
>I think he knows full well he's not doing anything purposeful.
The line of reason on his side could very well be something like:
>Well, guys looking at naked woman on an platform of freedom is fun and all, but you have to remember that there are lines you should not cross, just because you could. [posts CP as example of such a line]
Now, was that a good idea? No, probably not, but then again nobody said that his point or way of making that point is a good one. This could be a scenario similar to the BehindTheMeme-thing that happened some time ago, bad articulation and/or delivery are not unlikely reasons.
>but there isn't a point to be made with CP here. Similar images are on the clearnet.
Depends on his point, really. If it is what I've written above, then yes, posting CP was not necessary and should have been avoided. However, there are valid points to be made using CP, but again I'm fairly sure this instance is not one of them.

@caryoscelus: I highly doubt that this is the point he was trying to make.
But what you said is actually an example of where using CP to make a point  can be justified. Showing the absurdity of CP laws in most jurisdictions, in this case. Actually posting (mild) CP while making that point hits hard and reinforces the point, since by most countries definitions the user is now guilty and could face around 1 year in jail and membership of a list that will unlock hard-mode in any job you might want to do after you served that sentence. All this and more just for something you couldn't have any control over.

Wow, looks like I'm getting more and more known to people here.
Also:
*Wanting to have me banned (presumably) just over the pomfpomfmoe hub*
That's mean, you know...
Thanks for the info. By any chance, do you know where the hub came from?
@nekololi: Yeah, I just seen his post. So is he running it, because the zite says that nofish runs it?

@Pigpog: Not necessarily wanting to post it, just wanting a place for it. So it doesn't get posted elsewhere as often, where people have to really worry about it(like as I said the hub maintainers for example).

@nekololi: It says that in the zite description, but 'Runner: Nofish' is the default when cloning a hub, maybe he forgot to change that. If you open the(0)-menu and flick the 'This is my site'-switch, it let's you see the zite description.

@nekololi: Currently not, but I'm fairly certain demand will come at some point and when it does, I think it's a good idea, to have something to point toward to.
This isn't intended to keep spammers at bay, but as a side effect this will take plausible deniability from them.
@P2P: Thanks for clarifying.

Nothing, since tor browser release 8.0 changed at lot of stuff.
Millchan is the only zite(to my knowlage) that adapted to the changes and thus is not broken. Every other zite(including ZeroMe) with media *and* bigfile upload is broken in some way for Tor browser users.
How high are your numbers? I'm seeing around 600 tor peers on my ZeroHello, as always.

I mean the peers for ZeroHello zite itself. My stats says I have 7X of 2564 peers. How do I, as a tor only node, have more peers then a clearnet one? ~~Are you on mobile?~~ (I just re-red what you wrote, never mind that) Maybe the mobile version searches 'less hard' for a lowered battery usage.

@Styromaniac: The intention for that most likely was, that comments should be held short, so conversation has more 'momentum'. Basically the same idea as twitters character limit, but without the actual character limit. But I agree it is more annoying, then anything else.

@caryoscelus: 
>If you care about anonimity, you should either use tor, or umatrix-like solution to block all outgoing requests from 0net sites to other hosts.
All of my yes.
>I don't think zeroboard was ever supposed to be serious anonymous site
Me neither, but the way it looks does imply anonymity to newcomers.
>he check is probably to avoid spam so that it can be kept as a demo w/o requiring users to load such spam
Probably. As I said, I don't think that there was any malicious intent, but nevertheless for a `Demo for dynamic, decentralized content publishing.` `zeroid.qc.to` is a pretty centralized single point of failure(and possible attack vector).
>Does it actually send a key? Or just a message signed with it?
Yes.
It looks like it's sending the current selected public key (=`auth_address` in context of zite development) to sign the message. However the value in the POST body is in hex and called `auth_key`and not `auth_address`, so I think it sends the(decapitated) `auth_key_sha512` or just the plain text hex encoded public key to the server. Which is strange, since that implies, that the server signs the message for you, which is also a bit concerning.
Alternatively, it could just be some session-id to prevent spamming and I'm overthinking things...

@Styromaniac: In mcdevs defense, this was fixed quite some time ago.

@nekololi: Zeronet (currently) has this annoying habit of cashing files in ram(or somewhere else, but this makes the most sense for me) while it's running, which it overwrites the original file with when Zeronet is shutdown.
What should always work is:
1. Shut Zeronet down
2. Delete the folder
3. Go into `[ZeronetDataDir]/sites.json` and remove the entry with the address you want to delete in it.
4. Restart Zeronet

While I agree that this is annoying, I can see why it is that way. You wouldn't want anything to be able to delete your owned zites, imagine what harm a (theoretical) privilege escalation bug in Zeronet could do, if that were possible. As far as I know its a damage control mechanism.

I wasn't thorough enough, that's what happened. Inside millchans data folder I ordered all users by last modified date, looked at who has posted in a short amount of time looked into the fist few users data.json files and confirmed, that that was the spammer. After that I took all users that posted in with that same last modified timestamp and compiled the list.
However what had (most likely) happened is that since zeronet is single threaded a lot of updates came all at one for millchan and were written to disk at the same time. Because I was only looking at the last modified date(which is equal to the time the files have been written to my HDD), I assumed they where also addresses of the spammer and took them in as well.

@Znnex: I guess it makes us 'mainstream', lol. In a weird way, anyway.

>What's the story with hubs and profiles on hubs?

The prevent the developer of a zite from being too powerful. If you make a zite that works without hubs, you control every single file anyone uploaded on there and with reasonable effort would be able to delete certain users/posts at will(or in other words censor them).
If the zite is made with hubs that that is no longer possible since the zites that actually hold the content are not (at least not all of them) owned by the zite developer(s) and thus cannot be modified by them. This way you only need to trust in the guy that runs the hub(which everyone can do with little effort needed) instead of the one who also controls what gets shown to you (and more importantly what javascript gets run).

>Is everything shared between them?

Kind of, everything you do on ZeroMe is stored on the hub you registered on(or chose in the hamburger menu if you registered on multiple hubs). If you visit ZeroMe for the fist time, you'll have no (content) hubs and thus will only be able to see the people that use either a `zeroID`-or `ZeroVerse`-ID. No posts no nothing. Then you need to start downloading some hubs. Once you visit a hub once(=downloaded it) ZeroMe will show you all users(regardless of ID provider), posts and comments that were made by those who registered on that hub or made comments(doesn't matter where they are registered in this case, it's only important that the ID-provider they use is accepted on that hub) on posts that are on that hub.

So aside from comments which are once on the hub where the post you commented on and once on the hub you are registered on, no data is shared or exchanged to another.

>Do I just sign up with one and when I visit another it will add to what I see?

Exactly.

>You have a hub and you're always being helpful so I hope this is a good place to ask :)

Thanks! If you have more questions feel free to ask!

It's been like this since Tor Browser 8.0 released.
The reason isn't actually specific to TBB but rather that Firefox changed the behavior of the `privacy.resistFingerprinting` config that is enabled by default on TBB. Since Firefox 60(I think) the popup will not show up, if the canvas access request was made in any iframe(manually setting canvas fingerprinting as allowed will still work, just the popup is not shown anymore). Since ZeroNet uses iframes for zite isolation and sandboxing, all canvas requests will be denied with out notifying the user at all.
Possible solutions include:
- An ZeroFame command that asks the user for permission to use the canvas element.(workaround, will expose all canvas functionality to the(not sure how the permissions are handled in Firefox, but if domain based: all) zite)
- An `MediaProcessing`-plugin for ZeroNet that will do common media tasks like image format conversion, resizing, cropping, extract thumbnails from videos and so on.(A proper, but more time intensive solution)
